items.quote_text: Each step is the journey. There is no need to rush.
items.norm: each step is the journey there is no need to rush | thich nhat hanh

items.quote_text: You have power over your mind — not outside events. Realize this, and you will find strength.
items.norm: you have power over your mind not outside events realize this and you will find strength | marcus aurelius

items.quote_text: A journey of a thousand miles begins with a single step.
items.norm: a journey of a thousand miles begins with a single step | lao tzu

items.quote_text: When you realize nothing is lacking, the whole world belongs to you.
items.norm: when you realize nothing is lacking the whole world belongs to you | zen proverb

items.quote_text: He who has conquered himself is free.
items.norm: he who has conquered himself is free | seneca

items.quote_text: Be content with what you have; rejoice in the way things are.
items.norm: be content with what you have rejoice in the way things are | lao tzu

items.quote_text: To seek is to suffer. To seek nothing is bliss.
items.norm: to seek is to suffer to seek nothing is bliss | bodhidharma

items.quote_text: Do not follow the idea of others, but learn to listen to the voice within yourself.
items.norm: do not follow the idea of others but learn to listen to the voice within yourself | dogen

items.quote_text: We suffer more often in imagination than in reality.
items.norm: we suffer more often in imagination than in reality | seneca

items.quote_text: When nothing is done, nothing is left undone.
items.norm: when nothing is done nothing is left undone | tao te ching

items.quote_text: The most important point is to accept yourself and stand on your two feet.
items.norm: the most important point is to accept yourself and stand on your two feet | shunryu suzuki

items.quote_text: Don’t explain your philosophy. Embody it.
items.norm: dont explain your philosophy embody it | epictetus

items.quote_text: The softest things in the world overcome the hardest things in the world.
items.norm: the softest things in the world overcome the hardest things in the world | tao te ching

items.quote_text: Sitting quietly, doing nothing, spring comes, and the grass grows by itself.
items.norm: sitting quietly doing nothing spring comes and the grass grows by itself | zen saying

items.quote_text: Wealth consists not in having great possessions, but in having few wants.
items.norm: wealth consists not in having great possessions but in having few wants | epictetus
